content.description: This one is really straight-forward and easy. The great thing about these easy routes here is that they don't have any ledge-fall potential like most easy routes do. Also, they're so easy to set up a top rope on the next route over so you can just fire them off one after the other and get 100' of climbing in in no time.
Climb the right line of holds. This route is spaced further away from the rest and has one rusted cold shut, and one good rap anchor. The crux is getting fully established on the brick.
content.protection: Top rope or nuts and camalots .3 - .5.

content.description: Climb the left line of holds. The crux is probably getting up to the holds.
content.protection: Toprope or free solo to the anchors. If you'd like to place gear, you could try placing nuts or cams in the .3 - .5 range. Since it's brick, crack size is pretty uniform.

content.description: Climb the holds to the top. It's a pretty straight-forward line.
content.protection: This is a toprope line, but I guess you could use trad gear if you like (nuts and Camalots .3 - .5).
content.location: The second line from the left.

content.description: Very short wall with four routes on it. The sandstone blocks stand about 3-4 feet high and then the brick begins. Artificial holds make the brick portion easily climbable. This wall is easily accessed from the back side for setting up top ropes. With the exception of Ledges to Heaven, the route names are bestowed by myself for lack of availability of information. If anyone has information on the actual route names, please provide them. Hunter, Randy and John, I'm talking to you. From left to right, the routes are:   Red Tape   Ledges to Heaven   Weak and Powerless   This is Dedication
